poem:
"Revelations of the Morning Paper"

Another dawn, another cause honoured with type;
Amanda Blanc departs heat, brings the light,
Claiming "timebomb" in a teacup - an overnight hype.
Bleating equality in the boardroom, out of sight.
Yet, still remains the morning, silent and bright,
Disturbed not by the clamour for another fight.
The world spins on, indifferent to plight,
Perchance to dream, in spite of the night.
